body.header: Read the advice below about how to deal with questions you don't know how to answer, and watch the video clips.
body.section:
How do I deal with questions I don't know how to answer?
1 Be honest and tell the examiner.
"I'm sorry, I haven't thought about that""I don't really know much about it""I'm not sure why it is like that""I don't really understand what it is about"
You are having a conversation, not an interrogation. You are not expected to be an encyclopaedia!
2 Or, have a go, make an intelligent guess. But let the examiner know that is what you are doing:
"Perhaps it could be …""Some people might say it is …""I've never really thought about it, but it could be …"
3 Get round a difficult question by guessing, saying "maybe", or "perhaps".
4 If it's Part 1 or Part 2, ask the Examiner to repeat the question. If it's Part 3 of the test, you can ask the Examiner to clarify the question.
5 Do not pretend to understand if you really don't know!
